Reviews.Title: “Courtyard by Marriott, Phoenix West/Avondale”
Reviews.Author: bootsykaren
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week here with a group of 60 people and have no complaints with service or staff. Everyone was very nice and the hotel was clean and rooms were very nice. The pool and courtyard were very nice as well and they have a small fitness center which is open 24 hrs. The only complaint is that the lounge is only open from 5 - 10 pm and the hotel itself sits, it seems, in the middle of no where. They do have a van shuttle until 3 pm if you need to go somewhere and don't want to drive. There is a small strip mall within walking distance. I would reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Great Courtyard - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: stevel30328
Reviews.Content: This is a new modern hotel. A bit off the beaten track, but I would reccomend it. if you are looking for a good rate and a new Courtyard stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Average for Courtyard”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip. This Courtyard seemed relatively new, so things were clean and organized. The internet seemed unusually slow and based on performance during the different time periods, I would guess that it was DSL. The room I had did not have a bathtub, rather it had a nice, large standing shower which I liked. Makes sense - who bathes anymore (unless your traveling with kids). I wish Courtyard would replace all their elevators - they must be the slowest in all hotel chains. Seems even the other Marriott properties have better ones. Overall, I'd recommend staying here. Clean. Convenient. Safe. Good amenities. But I have to expect that from a Marriott property, so I'm giving it an "average" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean newer place to stay”
Reviews.Author: palitigate
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip. This is not a luxury resort but if you want a small clean friendly place to stay, it is great. staff super friendly. Nice buffet breakfast was included in my package but was very reasonably priced if it was not included. Nice dinner menu although one would not know the lobby is also a restaurant. Great food actually. The location is odd in that you are at two intersecting highways and there really is nothing around there but because of that, convenient to jump on highway to get anywhere. Nothing in walking distance Rates were very reasonable. Room was modern and fine. Nice sized pool too. Free wifi was nice. Overall fine place to stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Courtyard on our annual golf trip. We had in mind to stay a couple of days and find a room closer to Scottsdale where all the golf courses for our tournament were located. After two days we decided to stay there despite a fourty minutes drive each day. Everything is just great at this hotel. It's new and the people just make this hotel a must stay. It is hard to judge an hotel on an overnight stay, but ten nights is more than enough to make a honest review. The rooms were spacious, clean and well designed. Modern yet well priced. A rare combination. All amenities are new. The bed was confortable. The proximity of several restaurants, movie theatre and shopping was a plus. Last but definitly not least was the outsdanding staff: Maria and Mike in the restaurant for breakfast were as good as it gets. Polite, smiling, helpful and a pleasure to have around. The lady at the bar was pleasant and knowledgeable. A gentleman at the front desk even called all the restaurants around to check for us which one would be open for thanksgiving. Nice touch. Thank you everyone for making our stay memorable. We will be back in July 2012 for another golf tournament.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, convenient hotel with great pool”
Reviews.Author: oden9
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about a week on business and it was a very convenient location. Close to the freeway and easy to get around. Lots of restaurants and shopping in the area, so no shortage of dinner options. The room itself was very clean and quiet with a comfortable bed and a large bathroom. There was an on-site business center with free printing and faxes. The pool was large, inviting and relaxing! Breakfast was included in the rate - which was a nice perk - and they had omelets and eggs cooked to order every morning. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: funtravel63
Reviews.Content: This hotel was reasonably priced, beds were very comfy, and service was excellent. Close to shopping, good food, and freeway. Although we never had time to take a dip in the pool, it looked very inviting. Would definitely stay here again if doing buisiness in the west of Phoenix..

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, and well-priced and efficient staff”
Reviews.Author: Cece B
Reviews.Content: We arrived late while traveling from Colorado to California. Without a reservation, we were quickly issued a room. It was roomy with a very generous shower. All the amenities were quite new. We especially liked not having to hunt for available outlets to charge our electronic gadgets; the lights on either side of the bed had built-in outlets, plus there were other easily accessible outlets around the room. The small bar area had a spacious fridge, and the sofa converted to a bed, also. (We did not use it, so I can't comment on how comfortable it was.) We would have been quite pleased to use this as a base for a stay of multiple days. The only drawback is the limited restaurant, which we did not try, but there were many options within walking and close driving distance.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, new, all amenities worked well, but $$ for the area.”
Reviews.Author: neco136
Reviews.Content: 4-day business trip to Phoenix. Commute to downtown or the airport is about 20min. Lobby: Clean, new, perfect for casual business meetings all day long. Liked the bar and (limited) meal service in the evenings if I did not want to go out. Local area: There's an outdoor retail mall about 20min walk plus movie theatres. 3-4 chain restaurants - were the usual fare. Red Robin, Chipotle, a couple of decent burger joints and a great Sushi place (not a chain). Cheap Golf at decent muni courses ( <$50 round) is about a 20min drive away. Popular eateries and nightlife in Glendale are 10min drive. Scottsdale is more upscale and better restaurants and nightlife - 35min drive. Rooms: Clean carpet, firm, comfortable mattress, down duvet, good, silent central heat/A/C, lighting was OK. pull-out couch and coffee table + small balcony w/ view of the back lot and highway. Room was a bit cramped for one would have been crowded with 2. 32" flat screen TV had cable only + few local HD stations + HBO(not HD), Free wiFi worked without a hitch on my laptop and iPhone but needed to log in again whenever I had not used it for ~30min. Mini Fridge and coffee-maker in-room. No bathtub - shower only with water-saver shower head. Amenities: Had an outdoor pool, hot-tup + decent, clean excercise room . The Hot Tub wasn't hot the first day but they fixed that after reporting it at the front desk. Breakfast extra charge at $11/person was not that impressed, given the nightly rate was comparable to a 4-star. No airport shuttle and transit is not an option - car is needed. Parking was free. Casual business centre in the lobby was good for browsing, printing and even faxing - very handy and everything worked. Overall: Would stay here again but would book further ahead to get a better rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: doctorsunnyd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Courtyard for 4 nights. The hotel is fairly new and very clean. Our room had a walk in shower which was nice. Beds and pillows were ok nothing spectacular. Our room faced the 101 freeway so we did have some highway noise.(the same side as the pool). Next time we will ask for a room on the other side. The pool was bigger than most Courtyards. It is heated and had nice chairs and loungers around it. The whirlpool was awesome. If you are traveling to the west side of Phoenix, this hotel is a great option. For us the location was great. There are good restaurants not too far from the hotel and a Walmart as well. Next time we go Phoenix, we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “At least it's clean.”
Reviews.Author: vwjou
Reviews.Content: I come back to Phoenix fairly regularly to help out with my parents and lately, I've wanted to stay at hotels just to "get away". Well, this is certainly getting away. Very, very far away from anything important, fun, or special. This is track home central (Tolleson/Avondale) and it's just terrible, unless you're going to Spring Training. The service was fine, ho-hum, nothing special. It's as clean as I would expect from such a big chain. But the location is awful, our room was crowded with this big TV dresser thing that took up half the room, and... well, let's just say I'm done with the chain hotels thing. It's partially my own fault, but if you want personality and something that isn't predictable and sterile, navigate away from hotels on the outskirts of Phoenix that look like mini hospitals. Blech.

Reviews.Title: “Neat & tidy”
Reviews.Author: VictorG
Reviews.Content: Place looks very new, on the outskirts of Phoenix. Stayed as part of a business trip overnight and was nice, not fantastic but nice. Beds, pillows, room all very good and comfortable. Gym and pool area very good. pool is heated. If can pick a room location, ask not to get an east facing room as it overlooks a car park, other rooms would have a better views. Tea and coffee facilities available at the counter with really nice cookies! Meals were reasonably priced at the restaurant and breakfast was the usual fare. Could also get omelettes if you wanted them; wasn't told about them by the waitress though.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel and mini-vaykay !!”
Reviews.Author: ChitownBex
Reviews.Content: I decided to go to the Phoenix area for two Chicago White Sox Spring Training games. I had never been to Phoenix before and I was a bit hesitant about booking a hotel based on just research alone. I also do not know anyone out there , so I could not ask any friends or family members questions. I did do extensive research on a few travel sites and after 5 hours I finally booked this hotel. The price was affordable (other hotels in the area were over 200 bucks a night ) and it stated that this hotel was close to the ballpark. I was very happy when I first walked in. The front desk lady was very nice and the hotel lobby looked beautiful. I was even happier when I walked into my room overlooking the pool area. It was beautifully decorated and very cozy. There was a fridge in my room and also a couch. The next morning I checked out the pool and the workout area. BOTH were lovely and clean. I used both areas with a smile !!!!!! When I came back from the ballpark after my first game, the front desk had cookies available to guests and there also was a cocktail hour (which lasted from 6-10 I believe ). The next morning I had the breakfast buffet and it was yummy. The following evening I had dinner in the bar area and it was very good. I was able to use the computers in the lobby/business area. This was extremely helpful when I needed to print out my boarding pass for Southwest airlines. The best thing was that use of the computers and the printer was FREE !! The hotel was indeed very close to the ballpark and there was shopping nearby. There also was an In-n-out a few miles away !! I love their fries and burgers ... such a treat for a midwesterner !! It was also very close to the major freeways !! I give kudos to the management here. The place was extremely clean . The pool water was perfect. It had the proper amount of chlorine in it as it didn't smell too bad , nor make you feel that there was not enough in it. The hotel employees were also very FRIENDLY. If I had a question , it was promptly answered. I FELT so welcome HERE !!!! If I ever make a trip out to Phoenix again , I would LOVE to stay here again !!! I highly suggest this hotel to a person visiting this area !!!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel at which to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TshirtM
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was great! Everyone did all they could to help make my stay a great experience. I'd stay at this hotel again, definitely!

Reviews.Title: “brand new and very clean”
Reviews.Author: ylee629
Reviews.Content: The hotel is brand new, room is very clean, business center in the lobby is convenient, and guest laundry room is spotless. The front desk lady Tanya is so friendly to help me switch the room type and give me a free travel sewing kit. They have a complete local restaurants list which is very nice. The free snack in the lobby every evening is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: luvinblacky
Reviews.Content: This hotel was such a joy to stay at. The front desk people are nice and welcoming. The rooms are modern, comfortable, and clean. It was like staying in a mini apartment. The only thing I could say is that the refrigerator generator was a little loud but I didn't even notice until my husband pointed it out! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for spring training.”
Reviews.Author: TenaciousJDD
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and clean. The proximity to several baseball spring training camps is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, roomy and safe location”
Reviews.Author: bartschmid
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, good location, roomy and in a safe area. Right off I-10. The rooms were quiet and the beds were good and comfortable. You have to pay a fee for breakfast and/or dinner, however, we were not able to partake in either one. This was a one night stop and it met all of our requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: Herdcyclone
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel out of a lineup of potential hotels when I booked a package with Southwest Airlines. I took the family to AZ for spring training. It was a short drive to the Brewers and White Sox/Dodgers facilities. I am not really sure of the price, as it was in the package, but based on comparable hotels, it was probably pretty good. Room was nice, but a little on the smallish size I thought. I had a King, and I could tell by the layout of the exterior, my room was a couple feet shorter than other rooms. I did have a loveseat/hideaway bed, which was nice to have. Free wireless internet, which was nice. I hate having to pay for that. The breakfast is NOT free. They have cook to order and continental, but even the con. is 6 bucks. A little pricey for what it was I thought. If you see a picture of the pool on their website--it looks big, and it is. Much larger than a typical hotel pool. Hardly anybody was ever in it. The hotel obviously caters to the business traveler, who probably isn't a big swimmer. My kids loved it, and the hot tub was nice and big too. Staff was very friendly. Never really used them that much, but always hellos when going by the front desk, and if I did ask anything, they were always nice-no surly attitudes. Had a better than average fitness center too. It was close to the freeways, easy to get to, and had a couple shopping centers close if you needed to pick anything up. I would recommend, my only surprise was the charge for breakfast, which seemed a little on the high side for what it was. Otherwise a pleasant, clean, safe, convenient place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AGRandy
Reviews.Content: I was on business last week for calls out in the West Phoenix area, and chose this hotel for the rate and for the overall ranking from users on this site. First off, the hotel is on the west end of town, but for my purposes this was great. Close to a mall and other resturants if that is something you need. The staff was fine, I only interacted with them when I walked in to check in and everyday when I walked in and out of the hotel. I worked out in their gym and it is superior to many of the hotels that I have been in in the past, for a courtyard or similar style hotel. Had several treadmills, and other machines, and a nice area for free weights. My favorite thing about this hotel was the bar and food they served for dinner. I was on business and normally when I'm by myself I'm not a big fan of going to restaurants to eat by myself so I'll typically just grab something and take it back to my room. This hotel was great, friendly bar tender and the food was fine. Yeah it's not going to get rave reviews, but it served its purpose. I didn't have to drive anywhere to have a drink and get some good comfort food. The rooms were fine. I had a stand up shower in my room, which I"m a big fan of instead of the tub. Bed was top notch. Overall, again rating this with similar hotels in the same class, I would rate this one way at the top!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This NEw Hotel”
Reviews.Author: joslync
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 2 months old and gorgeous. We stayed for one night and were impressed with all the amenities and service. We arrived about 1pm and were worried that we couldn't check in early, but they took care of us right away and even honored our request of changing the room to a king bed. The room was spectacular, very clean, and spacious. The king room had a sofa bed and large flat screen TV which my husband enjoyed. The bed was coomfy. The bathroom was very large and the shower can equipped with handle bars (this was a perfect for my aunt who is disabled). The hotel provided cookies in the evening and had a full bar, which my husband and I took advantage of. The gym was a perfect size fully equipped with all the machinery you need. The business center was small, but suficed out need to check our email. Overall, I would definately stay at this hotel again. And what a steal with AAA rates I only paid 80.00!
